article.paragraph: Ann Druyan(IPAc-enˈdri.ænrespellDREEan;In the revised edition ofCosmos: A Personal Voyage, Ann Druyan introduces herself in aYouTubeL1-D2X5_9CQprologue to Episode No. 1.born June 13, 1949) is an American author and producer specializing in productions aboutcosmologyandpopular science. She was a co-writer of the 1980Public Broadcasting ServicePBSDocumentary filmdocumentaryseriesCosmos: A Personal VoyageCosmos, hosted byCarl Sagan(19341996), whom she married in 1981. She is the creator/producer/writer of the follow-up,Cosmos: A Spacetime Odyssey.
She was in charge of music selections that were included with the pioneering spacecraft,Voyager 1andVoyager 2.
article.heading: Personal life
article.paragraph: Druyan was born in Queens, New York, the daughter of Pearl A. (Goldsmith) and Harry Druyan, who co-owned a knitware firm.cite newsOn the trail of the meaning of lifeToronto StarJ.828 November 1992http://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/thestar/access/460161891.html?FMTcite newshttp://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?resPaid Notice: Deaths DRUYAN, PEARL A. article.heading: Television and movie writing career
article.paragraph: File:Dr Neil deGrasse Tyson and Ann Druyan in Sydney.JPGthumbleftDr.Neil deGrasse Tysonand Ann Druyan in SydneyDruyan was one of the three writers of theTV seriesCosmos: A Personal Voyage, along withCarl SaganandSteven Soter, and afilm producerproducerfor themotion pictureContact (1997 American film)Contact.

Druyan is the chief executive officer and the co-founder of Cosmos Studios. In 2009, she distributed a series ofpodcastscalledAt Home in the Cosmos with Annie Druyanin which she described her works, the life of her husband,Carl Sagan, and their marriage.

In 2011, it was announced that Druyan would be part of the writing and production teams for a sequel toCosmos: A Personal Voyage, to be calledCosmos: A Spacetime Odyssey, which began airing in March 2014.cite newsVerganoDanNeil deGrasse Tyson tweets for science literacyhttp://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/columnist/vergano/2012/10/20/neil-degrasse-tyson-sagan/1644383/[[USA Today]]29 October 20122012-10-20Cite webhttps://twitter.com/neiltyson/statuses/214467960528572417neiltysonTwitter.com2012-06-22{{inconsistent citations}}Episodes premiered onFox Broadcasting CompanyFoxand also aired onNational Geographic Channelon the same night.cite newsWallensteinAndrewTCA: Fox aims for repeat-free skedhttp://www.variety.com/article/VR1118040962[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]29 October 2012
article.heading: Career as an author
article.paragraph: Druyan and Sagan cowrote the booksComet (book)Comet,Shadows of Forgotten Ancestors (book)Shadows of Forgotten Ancestors, and sections ofThe Demon-Haunted World. She also wrote the updated introduction to Sagan's bookThe Cosmic Connection, the epilogue ofBillions and Billions, and her own novel,A Famous Broken Heart.
Druyan was responsible for the selection of the music on theVoyager Golden Recordfor the exploratory missions of theSolar SystemVoyager 1andVoyager 2.
article.heading: Activism
article.paragraph: Druyan has served on the Board of Directors of theNational Organization for the Reform of Marijuana Laws(NORML) for over 10 years and was president from 2006 to 2010.Cite webAbout NORML, Ann Druyan http://norml.org/index.cfm?Group_ID2007-12-26http://web.archive.org/web/20071213022754/http://norml.org/index.cfm?Group_ID13 December 2007noCite webAbout NORML Foundation, Ann Druyan (President) http://norml.org/index.cfm?Group_ID2007-12-26 http://web.archive.org/web/20110104002920/http://www.norml.org/index.cfm?Group_IDAug 13, 2010
article.heading: Honors
article.paragraph: In November 2006, Druyan was a speaker atBeyond Belief: Science, Religion, Reason and Survival.

In January 2007, she was a juror at the2007 Sundance Film Festival, responsible for selecting the winner of theAlfred P. Sloan Prizefor films about science and technology.Cite web2007 Sundance Film Festival Jurors http://festival.sundance.org/2007/festival/jurors.aspx [[Sundance Film Festival]] 2007-10-01http://web.archive.org/web/20070907180052/http://festival.sundance.org/2007/festival/jurors.aspx7 September 2007no
article.heading: Religious and philosophical views
article.paragraph: In an interview withJoel Achenbachof theWashington Post, Druyan stated that her early interest in science stemmed from a fascination withKarl Marx. Achenbach commented that "She had, at the time, rather vaporous standards of evidence," a reference to her belief in theancient astronautsofErich von Dnikenand the theories ofImmanuel Velikovskypertaining to the Solar System.cite bookAchenbach, JoelCaptured by Aliens: the search for life and truth in a very large universe[[Simon & Schuster]]New York19990-684-84856-295–6Her interest in science came primarily from her interest in the philosophy of Karl Marx. ... Druyan herself had, at the time, rather vaporous standards of evidence for her many sundry beliefs (as she later acknowledged). She believed ... that Immanuel Velikovsky in the 1950s had correctly deduced the truth about the solar system. ... She believed in the ancient astronauts of Erich von Daniken.Druyan freely acknowledged her past views and also said that theyclarifychanged dramaticallyAugust 2015after marryingCarl Sagan.citation neededAugust 2015
